qas.question: when was the height of mosaic art in sicily?
Who adopted the Byzantine mosaic tradition?
Why did the Normans adopt a Byzantine art style?

answers.text: enhance the somewhat dubious legality of their rule

qas.question: Who was influenced by Western European and Islamic tendencies?
The Martorana church is an example of the best mosaic art in what part italy?

context: The heyday of mosaic making in Sicily was the age of the independent Norman kingdom in <a0_0>the 12th century<a0_0/>. The <a1_0>Norman kings<a1_0/> adopted the Byzantine tradition of mosaic decoration to <a2_0>enhance the somewhat dubious legality of their rule<a2_0/>. <a3_0>Greek masters working in <a4_0>Sicily<a4_0/><a3_0/> developed their own style, that shows the influence of Western European and Islamic artistic tendencies. Best examples of Sicilian mosaic art are the Cappella Palatina of Roger II, the Martorana church in Palermo and the cathedrals of Cefalù and Monreale.
